They will provide leadership for the strategy, systems, supervision, and structure of the programs. The Site Director will plan, organize, and implement a structured program consisting of engaging educational and recreational activities according to age group. They will ensure a high level of quality, communication, and collaboration within the Y Afterschool and Summer Day Camp programs that are responsible for 100+ children.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Recruit, interview, hire, train, and supervise staff according to YMCA policies and best practices.
* Manage administrative issues such as data entry (AS400, YS.net, DYCD etc.,), human resources, reports, snacks, space, security, and all other administrative duties/documentation required or assigned for the betterment of the program and branch in a timely fashion.
* Ensure that adequate supplies and equipment are kept safe and are available to operate a successful program.
* Promote literacy, multiculturalism, parent/guardian, and community involvement through appropriate program enhancements and activities.
* Manage Site budgets, revenue, and expenses.
* Maintain accurate records pertaining to licensing requirements, staff/child health and safety.
* Evaluate and document staff performance informally and formally during the program year.
* Serve as a liaison to the school personnel, specifically the principal and their designee. Create a Parent Advisory and Youth Advisory Group. Attend school planning meetings and PTA meetings. Develop community relations with other community organizations or programs.
* Facilitate and/or supervise the collection of data for Fordham University, DYCD evaluator assembling the data and arranging for its timely delivery as requested.
* Attend meetings and trainings as needed and/or requested.
* Supervision and planning of summer components/responsibilities and duties as assigned. Seek DOH license for summer camp.
* Adhere to all Department of Health, YMCA of Greater New York, and funder standards, expectations, and regulations.

 **Desired Skills & Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Education or related field required. Master’s degree in Education or related field preferred.
* Minimum of two (2) years of supervisory experience.
* Experience working with youth in school-age programs.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, knowledge of AS400 database a plus.
* Current CPR/First Aid/RTE certifications preferred.
* Must be available to work day times, weekends, and evenings, as needed.

 **Benefits:**  

The YMCA of Greater New York offers a variety of benefits to its staff members, including retirement benefits, medical, paid time off, free YMCA membership, and more! Benefit eligibility is determined by an individual’s employment status (i.e., full-time or part-time), tenure, and/or the number of hours scheduled to work. Click here for more information.  

  

**How to Apply:**  

If you would like to be a member of our dynamic team, please complete our online application and submit your résumé and a thoughtful cover letter that explains your interest in the role and our organization.  

  

If you are a current YMCA employee, please submit your application through the Internal Career Site in Cornerstone.

title: Archivist/Records Manager
description:
MPF Federal is seeking an Archivist/Records Manager in Jamaica, NY area who works in all phases of the records management lifecycle and has experience conducting records inventories, developing file plans, and drafting records control schedules. In addition to helping enhance an established records management program, the incumbent will assist in introducing new technologies, best practices, and effective implementation of procedures to ensure the program's viability and effectiveness. The Manager must also have a detailed knowledge of various electronic record-keeping practices, including, but not limited to, email management, digital imaging, cloud storage, and social media.

**Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree and 10 years of professional and relevant records management/archivist experience or
* Master’s degree and 5 years of experience.
* Demonstrated experience of conducting records inventories, creating file plans, and drafting records control schedules.
* Detailed knowledge of Federal records management issues and specialties and knowledge of various electronic record-keeping practices such as email management, digital imaging, cloud storage, and social media.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Certification in Records Management or Information Management (e.g., CRM, NARA Records Certification, AIIM records-related certification) is preferred and will be considered a strength.

MPF Federal is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. We offer a competitive compensation package including a competitive salary, medical benefits, PTO, holiday pay and more.

title: School Social Worker
description:
**Job Brief:** Westport Day School is looking to add a skillful and enthusiastic licensed clinician to their social work team to help provide top-quality and comprehensive therapeutic services to support and enhance the social, emotional, and academic functioning of students enrolled in the program.

**Responsibilities and Duties:**

· Provide long-term clinical services for a caseload of 10(+) students enrolled at Westport Day School

· Create and monitor social/emotional goals and objectives for students enrolled with Individualized Education Plans

· Maintain accurate and comprehensive clinical records for students

· Support teachers with incorporating therapeutic models into the delivery of class content and academic curriculum

· Participate in daily clinical rounds meetings and weekly professional development seminars within the school setting

· Collaborate with students’ community-based providers to establish appropriate and comprehensive treatment plans

· Provide therapeutic services to parents and families through school-based support groups and regular family meetings

· Facilitate and oversee social clubs and extracurricular activities within the school setting

· Run Friday professional development meetings and daily wrap up with teachers

**Qualifications and Skills:**

· MSW degree from an accredited social work program

· LMSW (required), or LCSW issued by the CT Department of Public Health

· Holds Connecticut School Social Worker Certification (071)

· 1-3 years experiences working in related fields and capacities

· Working knowledge of evidence-based psychotherapeutic practices and theories (CBT, DBT, mindfulness, psychodynamic approaches, relational models, etc.)

· Leadership skills, and ability to take command of a staff of teachers

· Strong organization, time-management, interpersonal, and professional writing skills

· Flexibility in the workplace, and able to work well under pressure

· Willing to submit to background checks and professional/licensing verification

We value supervision and professional development, providing copious amounts of both. Salary is competitive, and full-time positions include health benefits, PTO, and 401k contribution.

BIPOC encouraged to apply.

title: Inventory Assistant
description:
First Priority Group is a diversified manufacturer, dealer, upfitter and service provider of emergency and specialty vehicles seeking an **Inventory Assistant** to support our customers at our Flanders, New Jersey manufacturing facility.

**Job Overview:**

First Priority Group is seeking a highly organized and experienced **Inventory Assistant** to join our team at our Flanders, New Jersey manufacturing facility. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in inventory management, warehouse operations, purchasing and possess excellent computer skills. This role will play a critical part in ensuring accurate inventory levels and efficient warehouse operations to support our customers’ needs.

**Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Assist in receiving, organizing and maintaining inventory of emergency vehicle parts.
* Collaborate with the Purchasing Department to process parts orders, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery.
* Enter relevant and accurate data into the inventory management system, including part numbers, quantities, and locations.
* Maintain accurate records of inventory levels, locations, and transactions using inventory management software.
* Monitor and analyze inventory data to identify trends, optimize inventory levels, and minimize stockouts or overstock situations.

**Qualifications:**

· High School Diploma or equivalent

· Strong attention to detail and solid organizational skills

· Ability to lift and move heavy items as needed

· Excellent communication and teamwork abilities

· 3-5 years of experience in inventory management, warehouse operations, or related field

· Proficiency with ERP software, Microsoft Office suite and excellent computer skills. Epicor experience a plus.

· Forklift certification and experience operating material handling equipment a plus.

· Willingness to learn, grow, and accept change

**What You Are Looking For:**

First Priority Group’s number one priority is taking care of our team members and their families. You’re looking for a place where your excellence is recognized, valued and rewarded. We seek greatness and we know you do too. You enjoy being part of a team, especially a team where everyone carries their own weight and because of the team, everyone performs better. You want to be paid well, but more importantly treated well. We know you’ll want to stay because how well you’re treated at First Priority Group.

**Benefits:**

· Competitive salary

· Medical, Dental, Vision and Life Insurance

· Paid PTO including vacation, sick days and holidays

· Matching 401(k) retirement plan

· Career Advancement and Growth Potential

**Why FPG?**

What separates First Priority Group from the rest is we take care of emergency and first responders, as well as our own. First Priority offers strong competitive pay, company matching 401K, benefits (medical, dental, vision) and a team of over 100 employees including former and current fire chiefs, EMT’s, paramedics, police officers, firefighters, rescuers and more across our state-of-the-art facilities!

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

First Priority Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This means that we provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Parts Inventory: 1 year (Required)
* Warehouse: 1 year (Required)

title: Accountant/Controller
description:
1SourceVideo is a National Distributor that specializes in bringing synergistic post-production & video broadcast products to market, across North America & South America. 1SourceVideo offers competitive compensation, as well as full medical benefits, a 401K plan, a profit-sharing program, all in a friendly atmosphere. We are currently looking to hire exceptional employees that have knowledge of our industry and seek employment opportunities.

***Applicants must have a minimum of 10 years Accountant/ Controller experience.***

***In Office Position- No Opportunities for Remote Work***

***Starting Salary range ($75,000 - $90,000) is negotiable, but based on applicant’s relative experience.***

**Required skills and qualifications**

* 10 or more years of corporation accounting experience (inventory basis preferred) and 5-10 years of experience as a senior-level accounting or finance manager/controller
* Experience in preparation and process payroll for 40+ employees, including 401k & garnishment payments and sales commission
* Expert in Quickbooks and Microsoft Office are the must
* Advanced knowledge and skill to Microsoft Excel is strongly required
* Acctivate Inventory and Distribution Management software experience is a big plus
* Must have strong research and the ability of problem solve and self-initiate processes with limited guidance
* Must have strong detective skills & strong attention to detail
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills; experience of working with senior management
* Must be detail-oriented and highly organized and capable of multi-tasking
* Strong working knowledge of accounts receivable and accounts payable, in order to oversee & manage those team members’ work

**Responsibilities**

* Establish (in coordination with CFO) financial and operating benchmarks with focus on streamlining accounting processes
* Oversee and support accounting team with dynamic leadership that creates an environment of trust and productivity
* Provides financial information to senior management by researching and analyzing accounting data; preparing reports
* Reconciles financial discrepancies by collecting and analyzing account information and adjustment by journal entries
* Verification all vendor’s price sheets for accuracy
* Perform multilevel accounting reconciliation between inventory management system and Quickbooks
* Preparation documentation for 401k, workers’ compensation and AR insurance audit
* Conduct major vendor(s) annual accounting audit
* Maintains accounting controls by preparing and recommending policies and procedures
* Perform insurance claims, if any
* Work with HR and maintain PAPER DOCS for employees
* Insurance policies renewal (Medical, Workers’ Comp, Cargo, AR etc.)
* Process REFUND requests to resellers
* Bank Reconciliation
* Preparation, file & pay quarterly State Corporation Business Tax, State Sales Tax Returns for 2 states
* Preparation and assist CPA for corporation tax return and quarterly estimate tax
* Fill in were needed in department-AR - AP - banking-RMA credits and Activities

title: Assistant Director of Nursing (Overnight)
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**

Since 1875, South Brooklyn Health has established its reputation for clinical excellence and culturally competent care. It has designations as a Certified Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) Center, an Advanced Primary Stroke Center, an accredited Baby-Friendly Hospital, a U.S. News & World Report high performing hospital. The hospital's staff is as diverse as the patients they serve. Interpreter services can be provided at any time of the day or night in over 130 languages.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description

**Shift: 12:00am - 8:00am**

**Purpose:**

Under the direction of the Chief Nursing Executive, assigns, plans, implements and evaluates nursing care on an ongoing basis. Participates in planning, organizing, directing, coordinating and evaluating nursing service and nursing education programs during the evening tour and performs related work. Demonstrates leadership that is self-directing, creative and innovative with an ability to evaluate self objectively and function effectively in stressful situations; is tactful, relates effectively and works with and through individuals with diverse backgrounds.

**Specific Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Include technical, interpersonal and critical thinking skills.
* Assumes responsibility for the operation of the Nursing Department/hospital during the night tour.
* Assists in implementing organizational plans for nursing services that delineate nursing functions, define relationships with other departments/disciplines and ensure maintenance of clinically qualified nursing staff.
* Interprets policies/objectives of nursing services to staff, other disciplines and visitors; promotes harmonious working relationships; develops/maintains sound relationships with community, labor and professional groups.
* Assesses nursing services through rounds, chart reviews and observation/evaluation of nursing care; participates in a system of continuing evaluation of nursing services and directs/actually completes the evaluation of competency and performance of nursing personnel.
* Selects, develops and evaluates Tour III Administrative Nursing Supervisor Nursing Office Clerks; assists/guides in problem solving and other administrative issues.
* Participates in planning, organizing and evaluating nursing education programs; conducts/participates in meetings/conferences/seminars with nursing/hospital personnel.
* Is available as a resource person for the evening tour; assures supervisory coverage 7 days per week.
* Attends/participates in continuing education programs.
* Participates in accreditation and P.I., Discharge Planning and JCAHO activities.
* Functions as Administrator on Duty

Minimum Qualifications

1. Licensed and currently registered to practice as a professional nurse in New York State, plus (2) or (3), below.

2. Masters Degree in Nursing Administration, Education, Clinical Specialty or equivalent field and five years of satisfactory nursing experience, of which three years shall have been in a supervisory or teaching capacity; or a Baccalaureate Degree in Nursing and six years of satisfactory nursing experience, four years of which shall have been in a supervisory or teaching capacity.

3. A satisfactory equivalent of education and experience. However, all candidates must be licensed and currently registered to practice as a Professional Nurse in New York State.

Department Preferences

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**

* Leadership characteristics required to achieve multidisciplinary approach to achieve the mission, vision, and goals of the organization
* Implements performance improvement initiatives and measures outcomes
* Data driven and results-oriented
* Demonstrates strategic and operational agility
* Experience in health care administration in a large and complex setting
* Applies patient-centered approach

**NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:**

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

description:
**Summary**

The Store Associate is responsible for providing customers with a leading shopping experience, while consistently meeting the store’s sales goals by performing the following main duties:

* Ensures high levels of customer satisfaction through excellent sales and service.
* Actively welcomes, seeks out, and engages customers within the store.
* Assess customers needs and provides assistance and information on product features.
* Responsible for achieving personal sales goals.
* Prioritizes time to achieve individual and team tasks to be completed.
* Uses resources in a conscientious and effective manner.
* Stays up-to-date on and remains knowledgeable on products offered.
* Maintain store’s visual appearance in high standards.
* Promoting customer loyalty plans
* Maintains company standards regarding personal sales metrics.
* Performs cashiering, stockroom upkeep and store upkeep as needed.
* Additional responsibilities such as key carrying for opening and closing store procedures, including cash reconciliation, banking, reporting, and security as required.
* Adhere and uphold all company policies and procedures.
* Additional duties and projects as required.

Required Education and/or Experience

0 – 1 year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Required Computer and/or Technical Skills

Should have basic to intermediate knowledge and abilities with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

Core Competencies:

Communication Skills

Must be an effective communicator with internal and external individuals at all levels. This includes spoken, written, electronic, and presentation skills. Communication should be consistently constructive and professional.

Decision Making and Problem Solving Skills

Able to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Able to analyze results at a micro and macro level and present findings. Makes routine decisions following established policies and procedures; collaborates with manager to gain assistance when complex issues arise.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these functions. Individuals must be 18 years of age or older.

The minimum requirements include the following but reasonable accommodations may be made as related to an employee’s religion, ethnicity, or disability:

* Requires a set, weekly availability which meets the needs of the business and includes some combination of mornings, days, and nights based on the business needs.
* Requires availability on weekends and holidays
* Punctuality and regular attendance consistent with the company’s policies are required for the position.
* Must speak English clearly in order to converse with customers and effectively supervise staff.
* Must be able to read and write English and perform business-related mathematics in order to carry out normal business and understand corporate sales reports.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Requires standing approximately 4 – 12 hours per day usually 3 – 5 days per week.
* During peak sales periods (e.g. Holiday, Back-to-School), will work for long periods throughout a 4 – 14 hour day.
* Requires stooping and kneeling to place merchandise on customer’s feet as well as reaching and pulling to obtain or stock merchandise on storage racks.
* May be required to climb a ladder or ascend/descend stairs in order to stock and/or acquire merchandise for sale.
* Required to lift items weighing 5 – 25 lbs regularly. In certain circumstances, weights may be higher.
* Must have good vision, including color differentiation.
* The work environment for this position is a moderately noisy retail setting.

*The company reserves the right to modify this job description with or without notice. Employees may be asked to perform additional duties outside of normal job scope on a temporary basis per company policy.*

title: LPN - Urology
description:
**Essential Job functions**:

* Responsible for providing professional nursing care to the office patients in noncomplex situations under the supervision of Physician and Clinical Practice Manager or Clinical Coordinator.
* Delivers direct patient care within the scope of licensure and in accordance with SMG policy.
* Assumes accountability for the quality of care, which he/she has delivered including maintaining standard precautions.
* Maintains efficient patient flow.
* Collects lab specimens according to departmental guidelines. Accurately labels specimens.
* Prioritizes patient care by implementing physician orders and nursing procedures. Documents appropriately in the Electronic Health Record (EHR).
* Assures all patients are correctly identified prior to providing and/or documenting care.
* Communicates & provides care consistent with age, cultural, spiritual and developmental needs of the patient.
* Employs appropriate and timely use of Tasking in EHR.
* Schedules appointments appropriately and accurately according to department guidelines.
* Administers injections according to appropriate protocol. Documents injections accurately in HER
* Appropriately demonstrates telephone triage protocols and document in EHR.
* Effectively communicates problems, concerns or issues to the Office Supervisor/Manager appropriately and promptly.
* Ensures proper preparation for patient visit. Prepares pertinent information needed for patient visit.
* Obtains vital signs: BP, temp, pulse, height & weight accurately and completely as required. Documents appropriately in EHR.
* Reviews and updates medication list in EHR. Demonstrates understanding of prescription control and prescription refill procedures. Accurately and completely documents known allergies in EHR.
* Appropriately enters orders and schedules appointments in the Practice Management System (PMS) and EHR.
* Provides referrals and/or consult orders appropriately and in a timely manner in the PMS and EHR.
* Facilitates transition of care to UCC/Hospital.

**General Job functions:**

* Appropriately adheres to universal safety precautions when administering medications and disposal of medical waste.
* Maintains proficiency with department specific equipment troubleshoots and reports malfunctions promptly.
* Checks and maintains logs for emergency equipment according to policy.
* Assists in ordering and maintaining of all supplies as assigned.
* Demonstrates flexibility with various work schedules.
* Recognizes and performs duties which need to be performed although not directly assigned.

**Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:**

* Vocational / Technical School / Diploma Program required. Associates degree preferred
* New Jersey State Nursing License and BLS certification required.
* 0 – 1 years experience. 2-4 years experience preferred.
* Ability to communicate in English, both orally and in writing.
* Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.
* Ability to prioritize and organize multiple tasks in a timely manner.
* Experience with Standard Office Equipment (Phone, Fax, Copy Machine, Scanner, Email/Voice Mail) preferred.
* Experience with Standard Office Technology in a Window based environment preferred.
* Experience with patient care equipment preferred.
* Experience with EHR, Practice Management System and Departmental/Ancillary Systems preferred.

**Travel**: Ability to commute to satellite offices as needed.

title: Manager, Audience Solutions Group
description:
**Company Description**  

Zenith is the ROI Agency. Our more than 6,000 specialists across 95 markets offer unparalleled capabilities in Media, Data, Technology, Commerce and Content. We put effectiveness at the heart of our work to solve complex challenges, drive successful business outcomes, and grow our clients’ businesses. Zenith is part of Publicis Media, the media arm of Publicis Groupe.

 **Job Description**  

We are looking for an enthusiastic self-starter eager to contribute toward leveraging the Epsilon data platform for scaling personalization with privacy-compliant data. This team will lead building an audience strategy supporting all Verizon brands.


The Manager will be accountable for both strategic and operational responsibilities, helping to discover and define target audiences for Verizon campaigns while also ensuring audience segments are sent to channel partners for campaign activation through collaboration with Strategy and Investment teams.


The ideal candidate is passionate and knowledgeable about audience planning, media planning/buying workflow and operations. She/He is self-motivated, curious, a critical thinker, and a team player.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with Strategy and Investment teams to build/activate custom audiences
* Be an advocate for the Audience Analytics team by evangelizing the platform which can unlock growth opportunities and customer experience enhancements
* Manage audience overlap, governance, and prioritization using behavioral and commercial audience insights to advise campaign leads
* Collaborate with Strategy on delivering audience insights addressing media strategy, profiling, messaging, and other insights to meet campaign goals
* Coordinate audience deployments and workflows across our channel partners and internal marketing, analytics, and planning teams for proper activation

 **Qualifications*** Data-driven strategist with demonstrated success in Audience Segmentation, Personalization, Marketing, Media/Investment strategy
* 5+ years of direct marketing experience preferably in a consumer products business
* 5+ years of experience managing and improving workflows across multiple stakeholders
* 5+ years of experience delivering accurate and insightful business reporting and applying critical thinking to data to problem solve and drive business performance
* Ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
* Self-starter with the ability to pick up a project and move it forward with limited direction
* Service-oriented, with an understanding and inclination towards good client service
* History of effectively managing customers and successfully working with internal teams to complete tasks and projects
* Experience with Python/SQL
* Experience with lookalike (LAL) and clustering models (k-means)

  

**Additional Information**  

Compensation Range: $81,500 - $128,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 9/23/2024.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Child Care Center Director
description:
Job Description

As the Center Director, you will oversee the day to day operations of our childcare center while demonstrating exceptional professional conduct and consideration for the educational development, safety and welfare of the children and staff.

Responsibilities of position include but are not limited to:

* Ensure compliance with safety standards of the children and staff
* Manage local and state licensing regulations and ensure state compliance and record keeping
* Manage staff scheduling to meet compliance standards
* Supervise and assist staff in enriching early childhood curriculum
* Ensuring adherence to all requirements of N.J.A.C. Manual of Requirements for Child Care Centers including renewal of State Child Care License
* Ensuring staff and parent adherence to all center policies and procedures outlined in Parent and Employee Handbooks
* Creating a positive rapport with all staff members through daily interactions
* Scheduling, supervising, observing, evaluating, and mentoring staff of approximately 13 employees
* Arranging staff to ensure ratios are being met at all times dismissing part-time staff when no longer needed
* Coordinate annual registration process
* Approving/denying staff requests for time off and scheduling appropriate coverage
* Receiving staff sick-calls and arranging emergency coverage
* Conducting and documenting daily classroom observation logs to aid in compiling monthly classroom meeting agendas
* Planning and conducting monthly staff room meetings and annual staff training workshops
* Recruiting, interviewing, and hiring applicants and assisting in training new staff members
* Completing initial and annual staff evaluation forms/ meetings
* Regularly monitor each classroom and provide ongoing feedback to teachers
* Planning weekly academic calendar themes/topics of focus to create monthly classroom calendars
* Approving and creating individual class monthly calendars
* Approving individual class weekly lesson plans
* Ensuring the implementation of a developmentally appropriate curriculum in all classrooms
* Coordinating special events and fundraisers
* Planning and overseeing summer camp program
* Arranging and advertising continuing education opportunities for staff
* Keeping craft supply inventory and ordering supplies
* Provide effective tours to potential families to drive enrollment
* Creating a positive rapport with all parents through daily interactions
* Assist the business owner with payroll processing while ensuring the accuracy of time keeping systems
* Employee engagement/recognition
* Onboarding and offboarding of new employees
* Oversee the purchasing of supplies and parent billings and collections
* Emailing notifications to parents and maintaining regular correspondence
* Addressing and documenting any concerns or incidents regarding children, parents, and/or staff
* Arranging and supervising parent/teacher meetings and providing parents with guidance and resources when necessary
* Reviewing and approving all forms to parents
* Closing center at day's end

title: Experienced Barista
description:
We are hiring for weekday shifts. We are unable to consider you for the position if you only have weekend availability.

-----------------------

We take our coffee as seriously as our hand-crafted, artisan food and are looking *experienced*  baristas with a passion for coffee and hospitality. Our baristas provide a positive and quality customer experience to customers to craft high quality drinks in a fast-paced, high-volume environment. This position requires enjoying a fast-paced environment. Liv Breads is not a laid-back, coffee shop-type environment!

In order to be considered for this position, you will have experience with a manual machine such as a La Marzocco, experience with dialing in a machine at beginning of service and throughout the day, backflushing, microfoam steaming, latte art.

We partner closely with Counter Culture Coffee for access to their training center, classes, and an opportunity to work with expert baristas. This is a wonderful opportunity for experienced baristas to learn from the pros!

Salary is commensurate with experience. Liv Breads offers a generous tip share program and food discounts to all employees, as well as health benefits, PTO, and flexible spending account to full-time employees.

*Job responsibilities:*

* Dial-in espresso machine at the beginning of the day, and throughout the day as necessary
* Expertly steam milk to the correct texture and temperature
* Prepare coffee and espresso drinks according to our menu and customer specifications
* Prepare batch iced coffee and tea
* Prepare batch bottled drinks
* Provide friendly and helpful service to customers with a focus on hospitality
* Follow and comply with all applicable health and sanitation requirements
* Work opening and closing shifts
* Work closely as part of a front of house team

*Skills and qualifications*

* At least 6-12 months experience working on a La Marzocco or similar manual machine
* High energy and engaging personality, professional demeanor, customer-service focused
* Personality and patience to handle high-volume service, and work collaboratively with a bar assistant
* Available to work flexible hours including mornings, weekends and holidays
* Maintain regular and punctual attendance
* Have a passion for, and curiosity about, delicious and quality coffee, breads and baked goods!

Open since August 2018, Liv Breads, with locations in Millburn and Short Hills has built a reputation for quality and consistency of product and service. Our specialty is artisan sourdoughs, laminated pastry, and fresh and creative seasonal sandwiches and salads. We are looking for team players, enthusiastic to work in an expanding business focused on fostering a collaborative environment.

*Liv Breads is an equal opportunity employer.*

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $16.00 - $18.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Paid training

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift

Application Question(s):

* Please tell us a bit about your availability, including and day/time restrictions. A barista shift can start as early as 6 am and end as late as 7:30 pm. We hire both part-time and full-time baristas and are specifically looking for candidates who have weekday availability.
* In order to be considered for this position, we do require an answer to this question.

We are currently hiring baristas only with experience on a manual machine. Liv Breads' baristas work on a La Marzocco machine. Our baristas dial in, manually pull shots, and steam milk according to a specific input/output recipe. Our beverages are hand-crafted, high-volume, and the machine is not push-button. 

Please give us some details about the machine you've worked on, and talk to us about dialing in! If you do not have this experience, please consider applying for our Retail Associate position.

title: Optometric Assistant 3-4 days/week
description:
*Optometric Assistant 3-4 days/week*

**DESCRIPTION**

We are looking for Optometric Technicians/Medical Assistants to work alongside our Optometrists. The work sites are at various nursing homes in Brooklyn, Bronx & Queens counties and surrounding areas. The candidate must be willing and able to work at different sites and have their own vehicle to commute to/form work-sites. Must be willing to travel up to an hour away from your home base. **We reimburse for mileage/gas and pay for tolls.**

We’re looking for reliable, motivated and well-rounded candidates to join our team. If you are interested in eye care, take pride in providing great service, like working in a healthcare facility environment and think of each detail as important, you’re the right candidate for this position!

We currently have openings for 3-5 days per week between Monday-Friday. Hours are from 8AM to 3PM or 9AM to 4PM approximately.

A healthcare background is required and eye care experience is preferred. We will provide proper training for the right candidate. The salary varies depending on your experience and work history.

You report directly to the Optometrist and are responsible for preparing and maintaining patient records, frame and lens selection, eyeglass adjustment & repairs, Fundus photography and getting residents ready to be seen by the doctor.

**Responsibilities**

* Update daily roster & prepare Optometry Exam chart for each person to be seen
* Discuss & document schedule changes (cancellations/refusals/etc..) with nurses
* Assist with measurement, fitting and repair of eyeglasses
* Assist Optometrist during clinical examinations as needed
* Take fundus images and submit for reading by the doctor
* Organize & electronically submit all required documents to Visualize office daily
* Respond to inquiries from office staff

**Skills**

* High School education or equivalent required
* Proven working experience as a optometric technician or similar field, preferred but not required
* Degree in medical assistance (preferred but not required)
* Knowledge of medical office management systems and procedures
* Proficiency in Google Drive
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Effective team player
* Neat and professional appearance appropriate for health care setting
* Willingness to learn on the job and to work flexible work schedule (days) is preferred
* Must have valid Driver's License & registered vehicle for daily travel

title: Epoxy Flooring Crew Lead
description:
**Epoxy Flooring Crew Lead**

**DO YOU STRIVE TO BE THE BEST???**

**DO YOU HAVE AN EXELLENT WORK ETHIC???**

**DO YOU WANT TO JOIN A WINNING TEAM OF ALL STARS???**

**IF YOU HAVE ALL THOSE QUALIFICATIONS, THEN YOU ARE A PERFECT FIT FOR OUR TEAM!!!**

ABOUT OUR COMPANY

Since 1975, Alpine Painting has provided painting & floor coating services for the Tri-State Area. Alpine Painting and Sandblasting, has years of surface preparation and coating application experience in a wide variety of facilities, including Warehouses, Hospitals, Manufacturing Facilities, or any project that demands commercial & industrial painting services. Our reputation of quality is achieved from our knowledge of materials and unrivaled expertise in the preparation and application of coating systems. At Alpine Painting, we know that great employees lead to great service, and, through our expert staff with established systems, our team and business will continue to expand for years to come.

We are currently seeking a skilled and experienced Epoxy Flooring Crew Lead to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in epoxy flooring installation and leadership, with the ability to lead a crew effectively and ensure projects are completed to the highest standards.

**Responsibilities:**

* Lead and supervise a team of flooring technicians on epoxy flooring projects, including surface preparation, coating application, and finishing.
* Plan and organize daily tasks and assignments for the flooring crew, ensuring efficient use of time and resources to meet project deadlines.
* Oversee surface preparation activities, including cleaning, grinding, and patching, to ensure proper adhesion and substrate preparation for epoxy coatings.
* Apply epoxy coatings, overlays, and sealants to various substrates, including concrete, wood, and metal, using rollers, squeegees, and other application tools.
* Monitor work progress and quality standards to ensure compliance with project specifications and industry standards.
* Conduct inspections and quality checks of finished floors, identifying and addressing any defects or imperfections promptly.
* Maintain a safe and organized work environment, including proper handling and storage of epoxy materials and equipment.
* Train and mentor crew members on epoxy flooring techniques, safety procedures, and best practices.
* Communicate effectively with project managers, contractors, and clients to provide updates on project status and address any concerns or issues.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in epoxy flooring installation, with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in commercial and/or industrial projects.
* Strong leadership skills and experience leading a flooring crew or team of workers in an epoxy flooring setting.
* In-depth knowledge of epoxy flooring systems, materials, and application methods, as well as surface preparation techniques and standards.
* Familiarity with safety regulations and best practices for working with epoxy materials and equipment.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills, with the ability to effectively coordinate and manage multiple tasks and priorities.
* Detail-oriented with a focus on quality craftsmanship and adherence to project specifications.
* Valid driver's license and reliable transportation.
* Authorized to work in the U.S fir any Employer

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications
* Health: 90% of Single Employee + portion of family; Dental; Vision
* 401K
* Paid time off and holidays
* Fun Company events
* Opportunities for advancement and professional development

SCHEDULE:

* Typical Business Hours: 7:00-3:30, with flexibility
* Location: Our Office

To arrange a **confidential** interview, send your **resume** along with a **cover letter** explaining what you like about this opportunity to: sidra@alpinepainting.com; Visit our web site: **www.AlpinePainting.com**

title: Orthodontist - Williamsburg
description:
At Tend, we do dental differently.

Tend is rewriting the playbook of modern dentistry by building a company around the patient and the provider. We believe that with the power of technology, a hospitality-driven mindset, and a top tier clinical team, we can make going to the dentist something to look forward to. Our vision is to transform the dental experience into one that is empowering, human and personalized.


Since launching in 2019, we have provided exceptional care to over 100,000 patients across five major cities: New York, Washington DC, Boston, Atlanta and Nashville. With thousands of five-star reviews, Tend has become one of the country's top-rated and in-demand dental practices, with over 650 team members to support this mission. We're continuing to grow quickly and looking for the best of the best to come join our team.

Tend's Orthodontists play a vital role on our team and must be a passionate, service oriented team member who is committed to our values, our brand principles and delivering exceptional service to our members. Our Orthodontists use cutting-edge technology to lead the clinical treatment of members to correct malocclusions anomalies and promote lifelong oral health.
### **About the Role:**


* Lead the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of dental malocclusions and oral cavity anomalies
* Assist in creating a unique, customer-focused dental experience for patients
* Develop and discuss treatment plan options with patients
* Utilize cutting-edge treatments and technology such as INBRACE© and other orthodontic appliances to treat patients
* Educate patients about on-going orthodontic care and proper oral hygiene methods
* Collaborate with General Dentists and Orthodontic Assistants to enhance patient experience and treatment
* Collaborate with non-clinical functional areas of Finance, People Support, IT, and Reimbursement to maximize the economic opportunities at Tend
* Collaborate with the People Team to hire an experienced Orthodontic staff with knowledge of regulatory requirements, clinical practices and a desire to create a patient-focused experience
* Participate in study groups with other Brand offices to network and share best-practices
### **About You:**


* Orthodontic Specialty certificate from an accredited university
* Current License to practice dentistry in state where employed
* Minimum of 2 years' clinical experience at a dental practice
* Experience with lingual braces, preferably using INBRACE©
* Proficient at use and interpretation of all relevant diagnostics
* Demonstrated commitment to professional development and CE
* Dedication to ensuring the highest quality of care to patients
* Leadership skills that value collaboration and an inclusive work environment
* Extremely resourceful, highly creative and high energy, able to brainstorm and implement new ideas
* High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results-orientation
### **The Tend Difference**


**The highest standard of care, anywhere.**
You'll work with highly-esteemed clinical leadership and experience-obsessed colleagues to provide the best patient experience possible, with access to technology that's head and shoulders above the average practice. You'll have exciting opportunities to collaborate with talented team members to make visits extraordinary. Our hospitality-driven approach to care means that patients actually look forward to seeing you.

**A top-tier clinical team who puts patients first.**
We value science over sales, and promote a culture of warmth and hospitality — our teams are recognized for going the extra mile for our patients. We trust our providers to put patient needs first, and never implement production quotas. We offer a warm, collaborative culture and are proud to be an inclusive, curious team driven by excellence.

**A new model that's a joy to work at.**
Tend has become beloved by patients and providers alike for combining beautiful work environments with cutting-edge clinical technology. Our providers are rewarded based on an innovative pay structure, as well as education programs that are training the next generation of industry leaders. And our top-notch total rewards packages include both best-in-class benefits and compensation. You'll not only have the chance to be part of a thriving, industry-changing company, but empowered to become an expert in your field and supported through continuing education.

**Tend is an Equal Opportunity Employer.**
Tend is committed to promoting a work environment in which differences are respected, employees are treated fairly, and individual contributions are valued and rewarded. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Please refer to our Privacy Policies linked here.
company_description: Tend is a dental services provider reimagining dentistry from the ground up and building new dental studios in major metro areas across the U.S. including NYC, DC, Boston, Atlanta and Nashville.

title: Assistant Teacher Infant Room
company: Glen Cove Child Day Care Center Inc
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a compassionate and dedicated Infant Room Co-Teacher to join our early childhood education team. The ideal candidate will work collaboratively with the Lead Teacher to create a nurturing, safe, and stimulating environment for infants (ages 6 weeks to 18 months). This role requires someone who is patient, attentive, and passionate about fostering the development of young children.

Key Responsibilities:

- Care and Supervision: Provide attentive care and supervision to infants, ensuring their safety, well-being, and comfort at all times.

- Lesson Implementation: Assist the Lead Teacher in implementing age-appropriate activities that promote physical, cognitive, social, and emotional development. Engage infants in activities such as tummy time, sensory play, and music.

- Daily Routines: Support the establishment and maintenance of daily routines including feeding, diapering, napping, and playtime, adhering to each child’s individual schedule and needs.

- Observation and Assessment: Observe and document infants' development and behaviors, noting milestones, areas of concern, and communicating these observations with the Lead Teacher and parents.

- Communication:Maintain open and positive communication with parents, providing daily updates on their child’s activities, mood, and progress. Collaborate with the Lead Teacher to address any parental concerns.

- Environment Maintenance: Ensure the cleanliness and organization of the infant room, including sanitizing toys, changing tables, and other surfaces regularly. Keep the room well-stocked with necessary supplies.

- Team Collaboration: Work closely with the Lead Teacher and other staff members to create a positive and supportive team environment. Participate in staff meetings, training sessions, and professional development opportunities.

- Compliance: Follow all state licensing regulations and center policies related to child care, including safety procedures, health guidelines, and emergency protocols.

Qualifications:

- High School Diploma or equivalent (required).

- CDA (Child Development Associate) or Associate’s degree in Early Childhood Education or a related field (preferred).

- Previous experience working with infants in a child care or early childhood education setting (preferred).

- CPR and First Aid certification (or willingness to obtain upon hire).

- Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

- Ability to work well in a team environment.

- A warm, nurturing, and patient demeanor.

Physical Requirements:

- Ability to lift infants and toddlers (up to 30 lbs).

- Ability to stand, sit, kneel, and bend for extended periods.

- Comfortable with frequent physical activity, including carrying, rocking, and playing with infants.

Work Schedule:

title: Phlebotomist
description:
This is a full time position: Monday - Friday, 8:30am - 5pm with rotating Saturday shifts (7am - 1pm)

**Essential Job functions**:

* Uses appropriate aseptic technique to draw blood cultures.
* Processes Stat specimens according to Summit Health SOP.
* Prepares collection containers with appropriate preservatives for patients and gives instructions for proper collection of specimens at home (Urine & Stool). Properly measures and records a volume for a 24-hr collection.
* Properly collects a COC Urine Drug Screen.
* Properly administers and collects a H. pylori Breath test.
* Properly handles orders on minors.
* Uses the correct procedure for completing paperwork and labeling of specimen for OVH Blood Bank specimens.
* Processes satellite specimens and delivers them to the appropriate department.
* Monitors inventory levels and follows appropriate protocol for replenishing supplies in phlebotomy room and storage area.
* Deletes/cancels orders as necessary with full documentation of reason. Ensures proper patient charge deletion according to departmental policy.
* Recalls patients for follow-up procedures or error correction as required. Documents callbacks in the lab logbook.
* Utilizes LIS for all applicable functions to perform job duties, including downtime procedures.
* Adapts work schedule to meet emergency staffing needs.
* Required Competencies:

o Demonstrates competency in all areas of adult phlebotomy\\*

o Demonstrates competency in all areas of pediatric phlebotomy\\*

o Demonstrates competency in all areas of infant phlebotomy\\*

o Demonstrates competency in performing skin punctures\\*

o Demonstrates competency in performing bleeding times including entering the result in the LIS and the logbook.

§ \\*Includes: Correct Order of Draw for multiple tube collection, using good judgment in evaluating specimens using established protocol, and demonstrating application of an adequate bandage to puncture site with explanation of puncture site care to patient.

**General Job functions:**

* Properly check-in a patient in a satellite lab, including arriving the patient on the day-list.
* Properly process lab and office collected specimens for transport to the main lab by courier.
* Contact a courier for a Stat pickup in a satellite office.
* Properly perform, log, and enter a result for a Rapid Strep and or Hemoccult test in the LIS. Notifies physician of critical (positive) result.
* Trains new staff in proper lab policies and procedures.
* Other job duties as required.

**Physical Job Requirements:**

* Endurance (e.g. continuous typing, prolonged standing/bending, walking)

**Environmental Risks:**

* Sharps
* Latex
* Combative Patients / Visitors

**Blood-borne Pathogens:**

* Exposure to infectious hazards, blood, body fluids, non-intact skin or tissue specimens.
* Contact with patients or patient specimens is possible.
* Unplanned or unexpected exposure.

**Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:** 

* High school diploma or equivalent required.
* Minimum of 2 years of phlebotomy experience required and drug screen collection preferred.
* Has the ability to perform all testing required at our satellite locations.
* Phlebotomy Technician Certification through the National Health Career Association (NHA) preferred; may be required for specific locations based on operational needs.
* CLA Certificate preferred.
* Knowledge of medical terminology, HIPAA guidelines and laboratory requirements to include skills in phlebotomy techniques with adult, pediatric, and geriatric patients, computer/data entry skills and phone etiquette are required.
* Attention to detail, ability to critically think, multitask, and maintain accuracy during periods of frequent interruptions in a fast-paced environment.
* Consistently demonstrate the ability to communicate in a clear and effective manner and read/follow procedures accurately.

**Travel:**

* Travel to satellite locations as needed.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Paid training
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Rotating weekends

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* working as a phlebotomist: 2 years (Required)

* Certified Phlebotomy Technician (NHA) (Preferred)

title: Quality Manager
description:
Quality Systems Manager Job Description

**The Quality Systems Manager will manage the food safety / quality (SQF) program of the industrial bakery in Newark, NJ and Clifton, NJ. Must be able to plan, organize schedule, and budgets in an efficient, productive manner. Focuses on key priorities. Effectively juggles multiple projects. Anticipates reasonable contingencies. Pays appropriate attention to detail. Must be able to manage personnel time.** 

· A minimum of three years to five years’ experience in the food manufacturing (bakery) industry.

· SQF, PCQI Practitioner; FSPCA, and HACCP Certifications.

· Knowledge of creation and management of Environmental and Allergens Programs

· Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, planning, and conflict resolution skills.

· Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with strong analytical and critical thinking skills.

· Ability to prioritize tasks and delegate them when appropriate.

· Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.

title: Behavior Technician
description:
Responsibilities:

* Providing 1:1 in-home Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) services to individuals diagnosed with Austin Spectrum Disorder (ASD)
* Establishing a positive relationship with the learner under the care of a Board Certified Behavioral Analyst (BCBA), receiving weekly supervision from the BCBA.
* Implement ABA therapy programs and behavior management techniques as directed by the BCBA based on the client’s treatment and behavior plan.
* Complete data collection for each client as directed and communicate notable findings from sessions to the client’s behavior analysis applications and forms.
* Demonstrate flexibility in working with a variety of clients with different needs and abilities.
* Maintain professional relationships with the client’s parents/caregivers and all other team members.
* Adhere to scheduled hours and always demonstrate professionalism.

Qualifications:

* High school diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor's degree in psychology, education, or related field preferred
* 1 year of experience working with individuals with autism or developmental disabilities preferred
* Additional languages (Mandarin, Spanish, etc.) are a plus
* Ability to effectively communicate and build rapport with clients, families, and team members
* Strong problem-solving skills and handling challenging situations
* Must be physically able to perform the job functions and work with young children with special needs.

Skills:

* Knowledge of applied behavior analysis (ABA) principles and techniques
* Familiarity with data collection methods and behavior-tracking tools
* Ability to follow detailed instructions and implement behavior plans accurately
* Excellent observation skills and attention to detail
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively as part of a team

This is an excellent opportunity for individuals interested in making a positive impact in the lives of individuals with autism. We offer ongoing training and professional development opportunities to support your growth in this field. Join our team today and help us make a difference!

BCBA/LBA supervision provided for BCBA/LBA candidates.

Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may perform other related duties as assigned by their supervisor.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract, Temporary

Pay: $26.00 - $28.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Health insurance

Schedule:

* After school
* Choose your own hours
* Day shift
* On call
* Weekends as needed

* New York, NY (Preferred)
